member.name: F:Apitron.Licensing.LicenseState.InvalidLicense
member.summary: License you are trying to set is invalid, so it's not the license the component is expecting.

member.name: F:Apitron.Licensing.LicenseState.Accepted
member.summary: It means that license has been accepted by the component.

member.name: F:Apitron.Licensing.LicenseState.LicenseIsExpired
member.summary: Indicates that license is expired, so you have to renew your subscription in order to get this component active again. But you still can use it with latest version released prior to expiration.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.EngineSettings
member.summary: This class represents a mechanism to configure processing of the PDF.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.EngineSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

members.member:
Registers the font in library's font cache.
The font data. Only TrueType(.ttf) and TrueType collection (.ttc) fonts are accepted. If is null. If there was an error during font registration. It means that the doesn't contain a valid font data. s

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.EngineSettings.UnregisterUserFonts
member.summary: Unregisters all user fonts from library's font cache.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.EngineSettings.MemoryAllocationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the memory allocation mode.
member.value: The memory allocation mode to be used by document processor.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.EngineSettings.ResourceSizeLimit
member.summary: Defines the resouce size limit in bytes that controls whether the resouce should be loaded to RAM or cached to disk. Valid only if the corressponding setting is set. See property.
member.remarks: Setting this property has effect only if is set to . Minimal value is: 1048576 bytes (1 megabyte) Default valus is: 5242880 bytes (5 megabytes)

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.EngineSettings.GlobalSettings
member.summary: Gets the global settings.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.EngineSettings.SystemFontPaths
member.summary: A read-only collection of system folders where the rendering engine tries to find font files by default, e.g. for windows it will be %WINDOWS_FOLDER%\fonts. If you wish to add custom font search path see property.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.EngineSettings.UserFontPaths
member.summary: An editable collection of user-defined folders where the pdf kit engine tries to find font files in addition to system folders. If the application is opened in trusted mode the paths are expected to be file system based, otherwise they will be processed as isolated storage based paths. An will be thrown as a result of attemp to add null or empty value.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.EngineSettings.UserFontMappings
member.summary: Gets a user font mappings dictionary, which can be used to map fonts used in document to a font with a particular name when font substitution happens. These mappings are being evaluated in the order of addition when the engine needs to resolve the font. Special font names are supported: "*" maps to all fonts.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.MemoryAllocationMode
member.summary: Defines memory allocation modes that can be used during PDF processing.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.MemoryAllocationMode.Normal
member.summary: Default memory allocation mode, all resouces are being loaded to RAM.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Configuration.MemoryAllocationMode.ResourcesLowMemory
member.summary: Only resources taking less than will be kept in memory, other resources will be cached to disk.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.ErrorHandling.DocumentSaveException

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Extraction.TextExtractionOptions
member.summary: This enum represents a text extraction options.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Extraction.TextExtractionOptions.RawText
member.summary: Text will be extracted as it appears in PDF content without any formatting.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Extraction.TextExtractionOptions.FormattedText
member.summary: Text will be extracted as it appears in PDF content and intelligent formatting will be applied.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Extraction.TextExtractionOptions.TaggedText
member.summary: Text will be extracted in xml format. <page><textblock attribute1 ... attributeN>text1</textblock>...<textblock>text2</textblock></page>

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Extraction.TextExtractionOptions.HtmlFragment
member.summary: Text will be extracted in html format. Page content will be wrapped by <div> and each text fragment will be represented by a preformatted, absolutely positioned, styled block.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Extraction.TextExtractionOptions.HtmlPage
member.summary: Text will be extracted in html format. Page content will be represented by a complete html page, and each text fragment by a preformatted, absolutely positioned, styled block.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Extraction.TextExtractionOptions.HtmlText
member.summary: Obsolete option. Please use or instead.

member.remarks: The correspondence between image space and user space is constant: the unit square of user space, bounded by user coordinates (0, 0) and (1, 1), corresponds to the boundary of the image in image space. Following the normal convention for user space, the coordinate (0, 0) is at the lower-left corner of this square, corresponding to coordinates (0, h) in image space. The implicit transformation from image space to user space, if specified explicitly, would be described by the matrix [1â„w 0 0 -1â„h 0 1]. So, before append image into the content should be modified transformation matrix

member.summary: This enum represents allowed filling rules.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Content.FillRule.Nonzero
member.summary: Nonzero Winding Number Rule.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Content.FillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: Even-Odd rule

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Content.LineCapStyle
member.summary: The line cap style shall specify the shape that shall be used at the ends of open subpaths (and dashes, if any) when they are stroked.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Content.LineCapStyle.Butt
member.summary: Butt cap. The stroke shall be squared off at the endpoint of the path. There shall be no projection beyond the end of the path.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Content.LineCapStyle.Round
member.summary: Round cap. A semicircular arc with a diameter equal to the line width shall be drawn around the endpoint and shall be filled in.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Content.LineCapStyle.Square
member.summary: Projecting square cap. The stroke shall continue beyond the endpoint of the path for a distance equal to half the line width and shall besquared off.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Content.LineJoinStyle
member.summary: The line join style shall specify the shape to be used at the corners of paths that are stroked.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Content.LineJoinStyle.Mitter
member.summary: Miter join. The outer edges of the strokes for the two segments shall beextended until they meet at an angle, as in a picture frame. If the segments meet at too sharp an angle, a bevel join will be used instead.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Content.LineJoinStyle.Round
member.summary: Round join. An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width shall be drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges of the strokes for the two segments. This pieslice-shaped figure will be filled in, producing a rounded corner.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Content.LineJoinStyle.Bevel
member.summary: Bevel join. The two segments shall be finished with butt caps and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments shall be filled with a triangle.

member.summary: Gets the function type.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.IFunction.Domain
member.summary: Gets the domain. The domain is an array of 2 Ã— m numbers, where m shall be the number of input values. For each i from 0 to m âˆ’ 1, Domain2i shall be less than or equal to Domain2i+1, and the ith input value, xi, shall lie in the interval Domain2i â‰¤ xi â‰¤ Domain2i+1. Input values outside the declared domain shall be clipped to the nearest boundary value.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.IFunction.Range
member.summary: Gets the range. (Required for FunctionType.Sampled and FunctionType.PostScript functions, optional otherwise) An array of 2 Ã— n numbers, where n shall be the number of output values. For each j from 0 to n âˆ’ 1, Range2j shall be less than or equal to Range2j+1, and the jth output value, yj , shall lie in the interval Range2j â‰¤ yj â‰¤ Range2j+1. Output values outside the declared range shall be clipped to the nearest boundary value. If this entry is absent, no clipping shall be done.

member.summary: This class is a Type 3 function define a stitching of the subdomains of several 1-input functions to produce a single new 1-input function.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.StitchingFunction.#ctor(System.String,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.String[],System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An array of 2 Ã— m numbers, where m shall be the number of input values. For each i from 0 to m âˆ’ 1, Domain2i shall be less than or equal to Domain2i+1, and the ith input value, xi, shall lie in the interval Domain2i â‰¤ xi â‰¤ Domain2i+1. Input values outside the declared domain shall be clipped to the nearest boundary value.

An array of 2 Ã— n numbers, where n shall be the number of output values. For each j from 0 to n âˆ’ 1, Range2j shall be less than or equal to Range2j+1, and the jth output value, yj , shall lie in the interval Range2j â‰¤ yj â‰¤ Range2j+1. Output values outside the declared range shall be clipped to the nearest boundary value. If this entry is absent, no clipping shall be done.
An array of k 1-input functions that shall make up the stitching function. The output dimensionality of all functions shall be the same, and compatible with the value of Range if Range is present.

An array of k âˆ’ 1 numbers that, in combination with Domain, shall define the intervals to which each function from the Functions array shall apply. Bounds elements shall be in order of increasing value, and each value shall be within the domain defined by Domain.
An array of 2 Ã— k numbers that, taken in pairs, shall map each subset of the domain defined by Domain and the Bounds array to the domain of the corresponding function.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Shadings.FunctionShading
member.summary: This class represents a function based shading. In Type 1 (function-based) shadings, the colour at every point in the domain is defined by a specified mathematical function. The function need not be smooth or continuous. This type is the most general of the available shading types and is useful for shadings that cannot be adequately described with any of the other types. NOTE: This type of shading shall not be used with an Indexed colour space.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Shadings.Shading
member.summary: This class represents an abstract shading.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Shadings.Shading.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Double[],Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The color space resource ID. The colour space in which colour values shall beexpressed. This may be any device, CIE-based, or special colour space except a Pattern space.

An array of colour components appropriate to the colour space, specifying a single background colour value. If present, this colour shall be used, before any painting operation involving the shading, to fill those portions of the area to be painted that lie outside the bounds of the shading object.

An array of four numbers giving the left, bottom, right, and top coordinates, respectively, of the shadingâ€™s bounding box. The coordinates shall be interpreted in the shadingâ€™s target coordinate space. If present, this bounding box shall be applied as a temporary clipping boundary when the shading is painted, in addition to the current clipping path and any other clipping boundaries in effect at that time.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Shadings.Shading.ColorSpaceResourceID
member.summary: Gets the colour space in which colour values shall beexpressed. This may be any device, CIE-based, or special colour space except a Pattern space.

member.summary: Gets the boundary.

member.summary: Gets the background.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Shadings.FunctionShading.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,System.Double[],System.String[],System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The color space resource ID. The colour space in which colour values shall beexpressed. This may be any device, CIE-based, or special colour space except a Pattern space.

An array of colour components appropriate to the colour space, specifying a single background colour value. If present, this colour shall be used, before any painting operation involving the shading, to fill those portions of the area to be painted that lie outside the bounds of the shading object.

An array of four numbers giving the left, bottom, right, and top coordinates, respectively, of the shadingâ€™s bounding box. The coordinates shall be interpreted in the shadingâ€™s target coordinate space. If present, this bounding box shall be applied as a temporary clipping boundary when the shading is painted, in addition to the current clipping path and any other clipping boundaries in effect at that time.

A 2-in, n-out function or an array of n 2-in, 1-out functions (where n is the number of colour components in the shading dictionaryâ€™s colour space). Each functionâ€™s domain shall be a superset of that of the shading dictionary. If the value returned by the function for a given colour component is out of range, it shall be adjusted to the nearest valid value.
An array of four numbers [xmin xmax ymin ymax] specifying the rectangular domain of coordinates over which the colour function(s) are defined. Default value: [0.0 1.0 0.0 1.0].

An array of six numbers specifying a transformation matrix mapping the coordinate space specified by the Domain entry into the shadingâ€™s target coordinate space.Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0]. NOTE : To map the domain rectangle [0.0 1.0 0.0 1.0] to a 1-inch square with lower-left corner at coordinates (100, 100) in default user space, the Matrix value would be [72 0 0 72 100 100].

NOTE : To map the domain rectangle [0.0 1.0 0.0 1.0] to a 1-inch square with lower-left corner at coordinates (100, 100) in default user space, the Matrix value would be [72 0 0 72 100 100].

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.Signature.ISignatureServiceProvider
member.summary: This interface represents a bridge between implementation and custom crypto service provider. One may implement this interface and use it for situations when direct access to certificate's private key is not available. E.g.: For Smart Card containing certificates marked as not exportable and not allowing the direct access to them, you may use crypto API provided by OS and implement signing using it.

member.summary: Gets the structure type, a name object identifying the nature of the structure element and its role within the document, such as a chapter, paragraph, or footnote.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StructureElement.ID
member.summary: Gets the element identifier, a string designating this structure element. The string shall be unique among all elements in the documentâ€™s structure hierarchy. The IDTree entry in the structure tree root defines the correspondence between element identifiers and the structure elements they denote.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StructureElement.Page
member.summary: Gets a page object representing a page on which some or all of the content items designated by the K entry shall be rendered.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StructureElement.Revision
member.summary: Gets the current revision number of this structure element. The value shall be a non-negative integer. Default value: 0.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StructureElement.Title
member.summary: Gets the title of the structure element, a text string representing it in human-readable form. The title should characterize the specific structure element, such as Chapter 1, rather than merely a generic element type, such as Chapter.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StructureElement.Lang
member.summary: Gets a language identifier specifying the natural language for all text in the structure element except where overridden by language specifications for nested structure elements or marked content. If this entry is absent, the language (if any) specified in the document catalogue applies.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StructureElement.Alt
member.summary: Gets an alternate description of the structure element and its children in human-readable form, which is useful when extracting the documentâ€™s contents in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StructureElement.ActualText
member.summary: Text that is an exact replacement for the structure element and its children. This replacement text (which should apply to as small a piece of content as possible) is useful when extracting the documentâ€™s contents in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes.

member.summary: Gets a single attribute object or array of attribute objects associated with this structure element.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes
member.summary: This class reprernsts a static list of Standard structure types.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements
member.summary: This class reprernsts a static list of Standard structure types for grouping elements.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.Document
member.summary: (Document) A complete document. This is the root element of any structure tree containing multiple parts or multiple articles.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.Part
member.summary: (Part) A large-scale division of a document. This type of element is appropriate for grouping articles or sections.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.Art
member.summary: (Article) A relatively self-contained body of text constituting a single narrative or exposition. Articles should be disjoint; that is, they should not contain other articles as constituent elements.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.Sect
member.summary: (Section) A container for grouping related content elements. NOTE 1For example, a section might contain a heading, several introductory paragraphs, and two or more other sections nested within it as subsections.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.Div
member.summary: (Division) A generic block-level element or group of elements.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.BlockQuote
member.summary: (Block quotation) A portion of text consisting of one or more paragraphs attributed to someone other than the author of the surrounding text.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.Caption
member.summary: (Caption) A brief portion of text describing a table or figure.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.TOC
member.summary: (Table of contents) A list made up of table of contents item entries (structure type TOCI) and/or other nested table of contents entries (TOC). A TOC entry that includes only TOCI entries represents a flat hierarchy. A TOC entry that includes other nested TOC entries (and possibly TOCI entries) represents a more complex hierarchy. Ideally, the hierarchy of a top level TOC entry reflects the structure of the main body of the document. NOTE 2Lists of figures and tables, as well as bibliographies, can be treated as tables of contents for purposes of the standard structure types.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.TOCI
member.summary: (Table of contents item) An individual member of a table of contents. This entryâ€™s children may be any of the following structure types: Lbl A label (see â€œList Elementsâ€ in 14.8.4.3, â€œBlock-Level Structure Elementsâ€) Reference A reference to the title and the page number (see â€œInline-Level Structure Elementsâ€ in 14.8.4.4, â€œInline-Level Structure Elementsâ€) NonStruct Non-structure elements for wrapping a leader artifact (see â€œGrouping Elementsâ€ in 14.8.4.2, â€œGrouping Elementsâ€). P Descriptive text (see â€œParagraphlike Elementsâ€ 14.8.4.3, â€œBlock-Level Structure Elementsâ€) TOC Table of content elements for hierarchical tables of content, as described for the TOC entry

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.Index
member.summary: (Index) A sequence of entries containing identifying text accompanied by reference elements (structure type Reference; see 14.8.4.4, â€œInline-Level Structure Elementsâ€) that point out occurrences of the specified text in the main body of a document.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.NonStruct
member.summary: (Nonstructural element) A grouping element having no inherent structural significance; it serves solely for grouping purposes. This type of element differs from a division (structure type Div) in that it shall not be interpreted or exported to other document formats; however, its descendants shall be processed normally.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.GroupingElements.Private
member.summary: (Private element) A grouping element containing private content belonging to the application producing it. The structural significance of this type of element is unspecified and shall be determined entirely by the conforming writer. Neither the Private element nor any of its descendants shall be interpreted or exported to other document formats.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel
member.summary: This class reprernsts a static list of Standard structure types for the level bocks.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ParagraphlikeCategory
member.summary: Standard structure types for paragraphlike elements.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ParagraphlikeCategory.P
member.summary: (Paragraph) A low-level division of text.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ParagraphlikeCategory.H
member.summary: (Heading) A label for a subdivision of a documentâ€™s content. It should be the first child of the division that it heads.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ParagraphlikeCategory.H1
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in conforming writers that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ParagraphlikeCategory.H2
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in conforming writers that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ParagraphlikeCategory.H3
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in conforming writers that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ParagraphlikeCategory.H4
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in conforming writers that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ParagraphlikeCategory.H5
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in conforming writers that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ParagraphlikeCategory.H6
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in conforming writers that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ListCategory
member.summary: Standard structure types for list elements.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ListCategory.L
member.summary: (List) A sequence of items of like meaning and importance. Its immediate children should be an optional caption (structure type Caption; see 14.8.4.2, â€œGrouping Elementsâ€) followed by one or more list items (structure type LI).

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ListCategory.LI
member.summary: (List item) An individual member of a list. Its children may be one or more labels, list bodies, or both (structure types Lbl or LBody).

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ListCategory.Lbl
member.summary: (Label) A name or number that distinguishes a given item from others in the same list or other group of like items. NOTE In a dictionary list, for example, it contains the term being defined; in a bulleted or numbered list, it contains the bullet character or the number of the list item and associated punctuation.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.ListCategory.LBody
member.summary: (List body) The descriptive content of a list item. In a dictionary list, for example, it contains the definition of the term. It may either contain the content directly or have other BLSEs, perhaps including nested lists, as children.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.TableCategory
member.summary: Standard structure types for table elements.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.TableCategory.Table
member.summary: (Table) A two-dimensional layout of rectangular data cells, possibly having a complex substructure. It contains either one or more table rows (structure type TR) as children; or an optional table head (structure type THead) followed by one or more table body elements (structure type TBody) and an optional table footer (structure type TFoot). In addition, a table may have a caption as its first or last child.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.TableCategory.TR
member.summary: (Table row) A row of headings or data in a table. It may contain table header cells and table data cells (structure types TH and TD).

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.TableCategory.TH
member.summary: (Table header cell) A table cell containing header text describing one or more rows or columns of the table.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.TableCategory.TD
member.summary: (Table data cell) A table cell containing data that is part of the tableâ€™s content.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.TableCategory.THead
member.summary: (Table header row group) A group of rows that constitute the header of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, these rows may be redrawn at the top of each table fragment (although there is only one THead element).

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.TableCategory.TBody
member.summary: (Table body row group) A group of rows that constitute the main body portion of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, the body area may be broken apart on a row boundary. A table may have multiple TBody elements to allow for the drawing of a border or background for a set of rows.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.BlockLevel.TableCategory.TFoot
member.summary: (Table footer row group) A group of rows that constitute the footer of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, these rows may be redrawn at the bottom of each table fragment (although there is only one TFoot element.)

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel
member.summary: Standard structure types for inline-level structure elements.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel.Span
member.summary:
(Span) A generic inline portion of text having no particular inherent characteristics. It can be used, for example, to delimit a range of text with a given set of styling attributes.
NOTE 1 Not all inline style changes need to be identified as a span. Text colour and font changes (including modifiers such as bold, italic, and small caps) need not be so marked, since these can be derived from the PDF content. However, it is necessary to use a span to apply explicit layout attributes such as LineHeight, BaselineShift, or TextDecorationType.
NOTE 2 Marked-content sequences having the tag Span are also used to carry certain accessibility properties (Alt, ActualText, Lang, and E; see 14.9, â€œAccessibility Supportâ€). Such sequences lack an MCIDproperty and are not associated with any structure element. This use of the Span marked-content tag is distinct from its use as a structure type.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel.Quote
member.summary: (Quotation) An inline portion of text attributed to someone other than the author of the surrounding text. The quoted text should be contained inline within a single paragraph. This differs from the block-level element BlockQuote, which consists of one or more complete paragraphs (or other elements presented as if they were complete paragraphs).

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel.Note
member.summary:
(Note) An item of explanatory text, such as a footnote or an endnote, that is referred to from within the body of the document. It may have a label (structure type Lbl; see â€œList Elementsâ€ in 14.8.4.3, â€œBlock-Level Structure Elementsâ€) as a child. The note may be included as a child of the structure element in the body text that refers to it, or it may be included elsewhere (such as in an endnotes section) and accessed by means of a reference (structure type Reference).
Tagged PDF does not prescribe the placement of footnotes in the page content order. They may be either inline or at the end of the page, at the discretion of theconforming writer.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel.Reference
member.summary: (Reference) A citation to content elsewhere in the document.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel.BibEntry
member.summary:
Bibliography entry) A reference identifying the external source of some cited content. It may contain a label as a child.
Although a bibliography entry is likely to include component parts identifying the cited contentâ€™s author, work, publisher, and so forth, no standard structure types are defined at this level of detail.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel.Code
member.summary: (Code) A fragment of computer program text.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel.Link
member.summary: (Link) An association between a portion of the ILSEâ€™s content and a corresponding link annotation or annotations. Its children should be one or more content items or child ILSEs and one or more object references identifying the associated link annotations.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel.Annot
member.summary: (Annotation) An association between a portion of the ILSEâ€™s content and a corresponding PDF annotation. Annot shall be used for all PDF annotations except link annotations (see the Link element) and widget annotations.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel.Ruby
member.summary: (Ruby) A side-note (annotation) written in a smaller text size and placed adjacent to the base text to which it refers. A Ruby element may also contain the RB, RT, and RP elements.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interchange.LogicalStructure.StandardStructureTypes.InlineLevel.Warichu
member.summary: (Warichu) A comment or annotation in a smaller text size and formatted onto two smaller lines within the height of the containing text line and placed following (inline) the base text to which it refers. A Warichu element may also contain the WT and WP elements.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.PageProperties.PageBoundary
member.summary: This class represents a page boundary.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.PageProperties.PageBoundary.#ctor(Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The media box defines the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page is to be printed. It may include any extended area surrounding the finished page for bleed, printing marks, or other such purposes. It may also include areas close to the edges of the medium that cannot be marked because of physical limitations of the output device. Content falling outside this boundary may safely be discarded without affecting the meaning of the PDF file.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.PageProperties.PageBoundary.#ctor(Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The media box defines the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page is to be printed. It may include any extended area surrounding the finished page for bleed, printing marks, or other such purposes. It may also include areas close to the edges of the medium that cannot be marked because of physical limitations of the output device. Content falling outside this boundary may safely be discarded without affecting the meaning of the PDF file.

The crop box defines the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped (cropped) when displayed or printed. Unlike the other boxes, the crop box has no defined meaning in terms of physical page geometry or intended use; it merely imposes clipping on the page contents. However, in the absence of additional information (such as imposition instructions specified in a JDF or PJTF job ticket), the crop box determines how the pageâ€™s contents shall be positioned on the output medium. The default value is the pageâ€™s media box.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.PageProperties.PageBoundary.#ctor(Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The media box defines the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page is to be printed. It may include any extended area surrounding the finished page for bleed, printing marks, or other such purposes. It may also include areas close to the edges of the medium that cannot be marked because of physical limitations of the output device. Content falling outside this boundary may safely be discarded without affecting the meaning of the PDF file.

The crop box defines the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped (cropped) when displayed or printed. Unlike the other boxes, the crop box has no defined meaning in terms of physical page geometry or intended use; it merely imposes clipping on the page contents. However, in the absence of additional information (such as imposition instructions specified in a JDF or PJTF job ticket), the crop box determines how the pageâ€™s contents shall be positioned on the output medium. The default value is the pageâ€™s media box.

The bleed box (PDF 1.3) defines the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped when output in a production environment. This may include any extra bleed area needed to accommodate the physical limitations of cutting, folding, and trimming equipment. The actual printed page may include printing marks that fall outside the bleed box. The default value is the pageâ€™s crop box.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.PageProperties.PageBoundary.#ctor(Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The media box defines the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page is to be printed. It may include any extended area surrounding the finished page for bleed, printing marks, or other such purposes. It may also include areas close to the edges of the medium that cannot be marked because of physical limitations of the output device. Content falling outside this boundary may safely be discarded without affecting the meaning of the PDF file.

The crop box defines the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped (cropped) when displayed or printed. Unlike the other boxes, the crop box has no defined meaning in terms of physical page geometry or intended use; it merely imposes clipping on the page contents. However, in the absence of additional information (such as imposition instructions specified in a JDF or PJTF job ticket), the crop box determines how the pageâ€™s contents shall be positioned on the output medium. The default value is the pageâ€™s media box.

The bleed box (PDF 1.3) defines the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped when output in a production environment. This may include any extra bleed area needed to accommodate the physical limitations of cutting, folding, and trimming equipment. The actual printed page may include printing marks that fall outside the bleed box. The default value is the pageâ€™s crop box.

The trim box (PDF 1.3) defines the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming. It may be smaller than the media box to allow for production-related content, such as printing instructions, cut marks, or colour bars. The default value is the pageâ€™s crop box.

Content falling outside this boundary may safely be discarded without affecting the meaning of the PDF file.

The crop box defines the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped (cropped) when displayed or printed. Unlike the other boxes, the crop box has no defined meaning in terms of physical page geometry or intended use; it merely imposes clipping on the page contents. However, in the absence of additional information (such as imposition instructions specified in a JDF or PJTF job ticket), the crop box determines how the pageâ€™s contents shall be positioned on the output medium. The default value is the pageâ€™s media box.

The bleed box (PDF 1.3) defines the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped when output in a production environment. This may include any extra bleed area needed to accommodate the physical limitations of cutting, folding, and trimming equipment. The actual printed page may include printing marks that fall outside the bleed box. The default value is the pageâ€™s crop box.

The trim box (PDF 1.3) defines the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming. It may be smaller than the media box to allow for production-related content, such as printing instructions, cut marks, or colour bars. The default value is the pageâ€™s crop box.
The art box (PDF 1.3) defines the extent of the pageâ€™s meaningful content (including potential white space) as intended by the pageâ€™s creator. The default value is the pageâ€™s crop box.

member.param: The white point is an array of three numbers [XW YW ZW] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse white point. The numbers XW and ZW shall be positive, and YW shall be equal to 1.0.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.ColorSpaces.CIEBased.CalGrayColorSpace.#ctor(System.String,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The white point is an array of three numbers [XW YW ZW] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse white point. The numbers XW and ZW shall be positive, and YW shall be equal to 1.0.

The black point is an array of three numbers [XB YB ZB] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse black point. All three of these numbers shall be non-negative. Default value: [0.0 0.0 0.0].

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.ColorSpaces.CIEBased.CalGrayColorSpace.#ctor(System.String,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The white point is an array of three numbers [XW YW ZW] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse white point. The numbers XW and ZW shall be positive, and YW shall be equal to 1.0.

The black point is an array of three numbers [XB YB ZB] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse black point. All three of these numbers shall be non-negative. Default value: [0.0 0.0 0.0].
The gamma is a number defining the gamma for the gray component. Gamma shall be positive and is generally greater than or equal to 1. Default value: 1.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The white point is an array of three numbers [XW YW ZW] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse white point. The numbers XW and ZW shall be positive, and YW shall be equal to 1.0.

The black point is an array of three numbers [XB YB ZB] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse black point. All three of these numbers shall be non-negative. Default value: [0.0 0.0 0.0].
The gamma is an array of three numbers [GR GG GB] specifying the gamma for the red, green, and blue (A, B, and C) components of the colour space. Default value: [1.0 1.0 1.0].

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.ColorSpaces.CIEBased.CalRgbColorSpace.#ctor(System.String,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The white point is an array of three numbers [XW YW ZW] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse white point. The numbers XW and ZW shall be positive, and YW shall be equal to 1.0.

The black point is an array of three numbers [XB YB ZB] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse black point. All three of these numbers shall be non-negative. Default value: [0.0 0.0 0.0].
The gamma is an array of three numbers [GR GG GB] specifying the gamma for the red, green, and blue (A, B, and C) components of the colour space. Default value: [1.0 1.0 1.0].

The matrix is an array of nine numbers [XA YA ZA XB YB ZB XC YC ZC] specifying the linear interpretation of the decoded A, B, and C components of the colour space with respect to the final XYZ representation. Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 0 1 0 0 0 1].

The range. An array of four numbers [amin amax bmin bmax] that shall specify the range of valid values for the a* and b* (B and C) components of the colour spaceâ€”that is, amin <= a* <= amax and bmin <= b* <= bmax Component values falling outside the specified range shall be adjusted to the nearest valid value without error indication. Default value: [âˆ’100 100 âˆ’100 100].

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.ColorSpaces.Special.IndexedColorSpace.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The color table. The colour table data shall be m * (hival + 1) bytes long, where m is the number of colour components in the base colour space. Each byte shall be an unsigned integer in the range 0 to 255 that shall be scaled to the range of the corresponding colour component in the base colour space; that is, 0 corresponds to the minimum value in the range for that component, and 255 corresponds to the maximum.
The base color space resource ID.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.SampledFunction
member.summary: This class represents a sampled function. Sampled functions use a sequence of sample values (contained in a stream) to provide an approximation for functions whose domains and ranges are bounded. The samples are organized as an m-dimensional table in which each entry has n components.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.SampledFunction.#ctor(System.String,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.SamplerDelegate,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32[],Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.BitsPerSample)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The domain. The domain is an array of 2 Ã— m numbers, where m shall be the number of input values. For each i from 0 to m âˆ’ 1, Domain2i shall be less than or equal to Domain2i+1, and the ith input value, xi, shall lie in the interval Domain2i â‰¤ xi â‰¤ Domain2i+1. Input values outside the declared domain shall be clipped to the nearest boundary value.

The range is an array of 2 Ã— n numbers, where n shall be the number of output values. For each j from 0 to n âˆ’ 1, Range2j shall be less than or equal to Range2j+1, and the jth output value, yj , shall lie in the interval Range2j â‰¤ yj â‰¤ Range2j+1. Output values outside the declared range shall be clipped to the nearest boundary value.
The size is an array of m positive integers that shall specify the number of samples in each input dimension of the sample table.

The bits per sample. The number of bits that shall represent each sample. (If the function has multiple output values, each one shall occupy BitsPerSample bits.) Valid values shall be 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 16, 24, and 32.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.SampledFunction.IncrementDemensionValue(System.Double[]@,System.Double[],System.Int32[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Increments the demension value.

member.summary: Gets the function type.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.SampledFunction.Size
member.summary: Gets the size. The size is an array of m positive integers that shall specify the number of samples in each input dimension of the sample table.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.SampledFunction.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Gets the bits per sample. The bits per sample is a number of bits that shall represent each sample. (If the function has multiple output values, each one shall occupy BitsPerSample bits.) Valid values shall be 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 16, 24, and 32.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.SampledFunction.Order
member.summary: Gets the interpolation order.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.SampledFunction.Encode
member.summary: Gets the encode. The encode is an array of 2 Ã— m numbers specifying the linear mapping of input values into the domain of the functionâ€™s sample table. Default value: [0 (Size0 âˆ’ 1) 0 (Size1 âˆ’ 1) â€¦].

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Functions.SampledFunction.Decode
member.summary: Gets the decode. The decode is an array of 2 Ã— n numbers specifying the linear mapping of sample values into the range appropriate for the functionâ€™s output values. Default value: same as the value of Range.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode
member.summary: The blend mode.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Selects the source colour, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source colour values. The result colour is always at least as dark as either of the two constituent colours. Multiplying any colour with black produces black; multiplying with white leaves the original colour unchanged. Painting successive overlapping objects with a colour other than black or white produces progressively darker colours.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Screen
F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colours, depending on the backdrop colour value. Source colours overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop colour is not replaced but is mixed with the source colour to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colours. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is darker; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colours. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is lighter; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop colour to reflect the source colour. Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop colour to reflect the source colour. Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colours, depending on the source colour value. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colours, depending on the source colour value. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colours from the lighter colour: Painting with white inverts the backdrop colour; painting with black produces no change

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop colour; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a colour with the hue of the source colour and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop colour.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a colour with the saturation of the source colour and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop colour. Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Color
member.summary: Creates a colour with the hue and saturation of the source colour and the luminosity of the backdrop colour. This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for colouring monochrome images or tinting colour images.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.GraphicsStates.BlendMode.Luminocity
member.summary: Creates a colour with the luminosity of the source colour and the hue and saturation of the backdrop colour. This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Patterns.ShadingPattern
member.summary: Shading patterns provide a smooth transition between colours across an area to be painted, independent of the resolution of any particular output device and without specifying the number of steps in the colour transition.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Patterns.ShadingPattern.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Patterns.ShadingPattern.GraphicsStateResourceID
member.summary: Gets or sets the graphics state resource ID of the graphics state containing parameters to be put into effect temporarily while the shading pattern is painted. Any parameters that are so specified shall be inherited from the graphics state that was in effect at the beginning of the content stream in which the pattern is defined as a resource.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Patterns.ShadingPattern.Matrix
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of six numbers specifying the pattern matrix. Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0].

member.summary: Gets the shading resource ID.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Shadings.AxialShading
member.summary: This class represents an axial shading.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Shadings.AxialShading.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.String[],System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The color space resource ID. The colour space in which colour values shall beexpressed. This may be any device, CIE-based, or special colour space except a Pattern space.

An array of colour components appropriate to the colour space, specifying a single background colour value. If present, this colour shall be used, before any painting operation involving the shading, to fill those portions of the area to be painted that lie outside the bounds of the shading object.

An array of four numbers giving the left, bottom, right, and top coordinates, respectively, of the shadingâ€™s bounding box. The coordinates shall be interpreted in the shadingâ€™s target coordinate space. If present, this bounding box shall be applied as a temporary clipping boundary when the shading is painted, in addition to the current clipping path and any other clipping boundaries in effect at that time.
An array of four numbers [x0 y0 x1 y1] specifying the starting and ending coordinates of the axis, expressed in the shadingâ€™s target coordinate space.

An array of two numbers [t0 t1] specifying the limiting values of a parametric variable t. The variable is considered to vary linearly between these two values as the colour gradient varies between the starting and ending points of the axis. The variable t becomes the input argument to the colour function(s). Default value: [0.0 1.0].

A 1-in, n-out function or an array of n 1-in, 1-out functions (where n is the number of colour components in the shading dictionaryâ€™s colour space). The function(s) shall be called with values of the parametric variable t in the domain defined by the Domain entry. Each functionâ€™s domain shall be a superset of that of the shading dictionary. If the value returned by the function for a given colour component is out of range, it shall be adjusted to the nearest valid value.
An array of two boolean values specifying whether to extend the shading beyond the starting and ending points of the axis, respectively. Default value: [false false].

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Shadings.AxialShading.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.String[])

The variable t becomes the input argument to the colour function(s). Default value: [0.0 1.0].

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Shadings.RadialShading
member.summary: This class represents a radial shading.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Shadings.RadialShading.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.String[],System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The color space resource ID. The colour space in which colour values shall beexpressed. This may be any device, CIE-based, or special colour space except a Pattern space.

An array of colour components appropriate to the colour space, specifying a single background colour value. If present, this colour shall be used, before any painting operation involving the shading, to fill those portions of the area to be painted that lie outside the bounds of the shading object.

An array of four numbers giving the left, bottom, right, and top coordinates, respectively, of the shadingâ€™s bounding box. The coordinates shall be interpreted in the shadingâ€™s target coordinate space. If present, this bounding box shall be applied as a temporary clipping boundary when the shading is painted, in addition to the current clipping path and any other clipping boundaries in effect at that time.

An array of six numbers [x0 y0 r0 x1 y1 r1] specifying the centres and radii of the starting and ending circles, expressed in the shadingâ€™s target coordinate space. The radii r0 and r1 shall both be greater than or equal to 0. If one radius is 0, the corresponding circle shall be treated as a point; if both are 0, nothing shall be painted.

An array of two numbers [t0 t1] specifying the limiting values of a parametric variable t. The variable is considered to vary linearly between these two values as the colour gradient varies between the starting and ending circles. The variable t becomes the input argument to the colour function(s). Default value: [0.0 1.0].

A 1-in, n-out function or an array of n 1-in, 1-out functions (where n is the number of colour components in the shading dictionaryâ€™s colour space). The function(s) shall be called with values of the parametric variable t in the domain defined by the shading dictionaryâ€™s Domain entry. Each functionâ€™s domain shall be a superset of that of the shading dictionary. If the value returned by the function for a given colour component is out of range, it shall be adjusted to the nearest valid value.
An array of two boolean values specifying whether to extend the shading beyond the starting and ending circles, respectively. Default value: [false false].

member.summary: This class represents a transparency group attributes.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Transparency.TransparencyGroupAttributes.IsIsolated
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag specifying whether the transparency group is isolated. If this flag is true, objects within the group shall be composited against a fully transparent initial backdrop; if false, they shall be composited against the groupâ€™s backdrop. Default value: false.
member.value: true if this instance is isolated; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Transparency.TransparencyGroupAttributes.IsKnockout
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag specifying whether the transparency group is a knockout group. If this flag is false, later objects within the group shall be composited with earlier ones with which they overlap; if true, they shall be composited with the groupâ€™s initial backdrop and shall overwrite (â€œknock outâ€) any earlier overlapping objects. Default value: false.
member.value: true if this instance is knockout; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.Appearance.Align
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of the elementâ€™s content, it can be Left, Right, Center aligned or Justified. Only acceptable for block elements, this property will be ignored if the element used is not a block. Left, Right, Center values are supported by all elements. In case of Justify is used â€“ only text elements will be affected. All elements inherit value from their block containers, only block elements can override parentâ€™s Align setting.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.Patterns.TilingPattern
member.summary: A tiling pattern consists of a small graphical figure called a pattern cell. Painting with the pattern replicates the cell at fixed horizontal and vertical intervals to fill an area. The effect is as if the figure were painted on the surface of a clear glass tile, identical copies of which were then laid down in an array covering the area and trimmed to its boundaries. This process is called tiling the area.

member.param: if set to true is colored.

member.value: true if this instance is colored; otherwise, uncolored.

member.summary: Gets or sets the desired vertical spacing between pattern cells, measured in the pattern coordinate system.

member.summary: Gets or sets an array of six numbers specifying the pattern matrix. Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0].

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.XObjects.Image.SoftMaskResourceID
member.summary: Gets or sets the soft mask resource ID of the image XObject defining a soft-mask image that shall be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity values in the transparent imaging model. The alpha source parameter in the graphics state determines whether the mask values shall beinterpreted as shape or opacity. If present, this entry shall override the current soft mask in the graphics state, as well as the imageâ€™s Mask entry, if any. However, the other transparency-related graphics state parametersâ€”blend mode and alpha constantâ€”shall remain in effect. If Soft Mask is absent, the image shall have no associated soft mask (although the current soft mask in the graphics state may still apply).

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.XObjects.Image.IsStencilMask
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is stencil mask. The instance should be a monochrome image in which each sample is specified by a single bit. However, instead of being painted in opaque black and white, the image mask is treated as a stencil mask that is partly opaque and partly transparent. Sample values in the image do not represent black and white pixels; rather, they designate places on the page that should either be marked with the current colour or masked out (not marked at all). Areas that are masked out retain their former contents. The effect is like applying paint in the current colour through a cut-out stencil, which lets the paint reach the page in some places and masks it out in others.
member.value: true if this instance is stencil mask; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.XObjects.Image.UseInvertedDecode
member.summary: Gets or sets an flag specifying how the source samples shall be interpreted. It is meaningfull for Stencil Masks only. If the flag is not set (the default for an image mask), a sample value of 0 shall mark the page with the current colour, and a 1 shall leave the previous contents unchanged. If the flag is set, these meanings shall be reversed.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.XObjects.Image.MaskResourceID
member.summary: Gets or sets the mask resource ID of an image XObject defining an image mask to be applied to this image. It's also possible to use an array specifying a range of colours to be applied as a colour key mask, see . If is true, this entry shall not be present.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.XObjects.Image.MaskColorRanges
member.summary: Gets or sets an array specifying a range of colours to be applied to it as a colour key mask.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Resources.XObjects.Image.Interpolate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is interpolate.

member.summary: Encrypt this document with RC4 40-bit.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Security.EncryptionLevel.RC4_128bit
member.summary: Encrypt this document with RC4 128-bit.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Security.EncryptionLevel.AES_128bit
member.summary: Encrypt this document with AES v2 128-bit. (default)

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Security.EncryptionLevel.AES_256bit
member.summary: Encrypt this document with AES v3 256-bit.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Security.Permissions
member.summary: This enum defines allowed access permissions.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Security.Permissions.Print
member.summary: Print the document (possibly not at the highest quality level, depending on whether flag is also set).

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Security.Permissions.Modify
member.summary: Modify the contents of the document by operations other than those controlled by flags , , and .

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Security.Permissions.Extract
member.summary: Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document by operations other than that controlled by flag .

members.member:
Add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive form fields, and, if flag is also set, create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields).
Useless when is used..

Fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields), even if flag is not set.
Useless when is used..

Extract text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).
Useless when is used..

Assemble the document (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images), even if flag is not set.
Useless when is used..

Print the document to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF content could be generated. When this bit is clear (and flag is set), printing is limited to a low-level representation of the appearance, possibly of degraded quality.
Useless when is used..

member.summary: Disallow all permissions.

member.summary: Allow all permissions.

summary.para: Represents a document that can be composed using flow layout rules applied to various content elements or content containers and later saved as PDF document using method.
It can be also saved to XML using and loaded from it using methods.
supports styling for its elements and itself using objects which can be added to its along with the matching expressions.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FlowLayout.ContentElement.FromMarkup(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a collection of elements using given text as markup. The markup looks similar to XML markup, given that each element will have its property assigned to the name or a set of names of the enclosing tags. The resulting list will contain parsed content elements(mostly textblocks) with assigned classes. A markup element can contain the following attributes: link, affects the property of the created element. If link destination starts with # then it will be considered as a otherwise as a . There is an additional attribute supported, href that works exactly the same. Bookmark, affects the property of the created element. Id, affects the property of the created element, so it can be linked to. elementType, sets the target content element type, currently supported values are: section, image. This attribute makes it possible to create sections containing other elements or define some of the elements as images. A few tags have special meaning: , can be used for putting images, e.g. creates element entry. Unit can be omitted or can be one of the following: auto|pt|in|px|cm|%.
, creates element entry.
,
    ,
      , create element entry.
member.remarks:
Given that markup text is in XML format and its parsing will be done by XML-aware utils, entries which don't exist in XML like   should be entered differently. So instead of <tag> mytext. </tag> the following entities will produce the same result:
<tag> mytext. </tag>
<tag> mytext.&nbsp</tag>
member.returns: List containing markup elements, if it fails to parse the given text it will contain the initialized using the parameter.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FlowLayout.ContentElement.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the background image for the element. The background of an element is the total size of the element, including padding (but not the margin and border). By default, a background-image is placed at the top-left corner of an element, and repeated both vertically and horizontally.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FlowLayout.ContentElement.BackgroundRepeat
member.summary: Gets or sets the background repeat value for the element. The background repeat property sets if/how a background image will be repeated. By default, a background image is repeated both vertically and horizontally.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FlowLayout.ContentElement.ScriptLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the value used to create subscripting or superscripting effect. It defines the level of effect, zero can be used for normal scripting, positive values are for superscripting, negative for subscripting. Affects textual elements.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FlowLayout.Content.Controls.Choice
member.summary:
A choice control element is an element linked to that contains several text items, one or more of which shall be selected as the field value. The items may be presented to the user in one of the following two forms:
A scrollable list box
A combo box consisting of a drop-down list. The combo box may be accompanied by an editable text box in which the user can type a value other than the predefined choices if it's allowed by the field author.

summary.para: The grid element, can be used to group other elements in rows and columns. It's a container for elements which can be used to define grid rows.
Grid control has special properties which can be set via matching or directly: for inner border definition (in addition to ) and also . Appears as block element by default.
Every document has default style set for element that uses single line and as default value for .

summary.para: Represents a grid row, a subcontainer element that is being used in element to group cells together. It can only be added into element and its styling is limited (only properties which can be inherited from plus background color value affect the appearance of the grid cells).
Links created using or and pointing to/from GridRow elements are also not supported. This behavior can be easily workarounded by adding a link to inner elements.

Each element added to grid row is being treated as a separate cell, so if you need multiple elements to be placed inside the singe cell you may use a to group them together. If you need the cell to be spanned vertically or horizontally you may use or properties respectively.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.FlowLayout.Content.PageBreak
member.summary: A page break element, controls pagination behaviour. Works on a page-level, has no effect being added to container other than . If the page has available space then current page will be finished and generation will continue on next page, otherwise blank page will be added right after and generation will continue staring from new page created thereafter.

example.code: FlowDocument document = new FlowDocument(); document.Add(new PageBreak());

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to open destination in a new window. member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Actions.URIAction
member.summary: This class represents a uniform resource identifier (URI) is a string that identifies (resolves to) a resource on the Internetâ€”typically a file that is the destination of a hypertext link, although it may also resolve to a query or other entity. (URIs are described in Internet RFC 2396, Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax; see the Bibliography.) A URI action causes a URI to be resolved.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Actions.URIAction.#ctor(System.Uri,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Gets or sets a flag specifying whether to track the mouse position when the URI is resolved (see the discussion following this Table). Default value: false. This entry applies only to actions triggered by the userâ€™s clicking an annotation; it shall be ignored for actions associated with outline items or with a documentâ€™s OpenAction entry.

example.code: URIAction uriAction = new URIAction(new Uri(string.Format("file://{0}/FileToEmbed.pdf", Environment.CurrentDirectory.Replace("\\", "/"))));

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Actions.URIAction.Uri
member.summary: Gets or sets the uniform resource identifier to resolve.

member.summary: Gets or sets a flag specifying whether to track the mouse position when the URI is resolved (see the discussion following this Table). Default value: false. This entry applies only to actions triggered by the userâ€™s clicking an annotation; it shall be ignored for actions associated with outline items or with a documentâ€™s OpenAction entry.
member.value: true if this instance is map; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.Annotation.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color. An array of numbers in the range 0.0 to 1.0, representing a colour used for the following purposes: The background of the annotationâ€™s icon when closed The title bar of the annotationâ€™s pop-up window The border of a link annotation The number of array elements determines the colour space in which the colour shall be defined: 0 No colour; transparent 1 DeviceGray 3 DeviceRGB 4 DeviceCMYK

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.Annotation.Contents
member.summary: Gets or sets the contents. Text that shall be displayed for the annotation or, if this type of annotation does not display text, an alternate description of the annotationâ€™s contents in human-readable form. In either case, this text is useful when extracting the documentâ€™s contents in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.Annotation.InteriorColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the interior color. An array of numbers in the range 0.0 to 1.0 specifying the interior color that shall be used to fill the annotationâ€™s line endings. The number of array elements shall determine the colour space in which the colour is defined: 0 No colour; transparent 1 DeviceGray 3 DeviceRGB 4 DeviceCMYK

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.Annotation.RectDifferences
member.summary: Gets or sets a set of four numbers describing the numerical differences between two rectangles: the entry of the annotation and a rectangle contained within that rectangle. The inner rectangle is where the annotationâ€™s text should be displayed. Any border styles and/or border effects specified by and entries, respectively, shall be applied to the border of the inner rectangle. The four numbers correspond to the differences in default user space between the left, top, right, and bottom coordinates of and those of the inner rectangle, respectively. Each value shall be greater than or equal to 0. The sum of the top and bottom differences shall be less than the height of , and the sum of the left and right differences shall be less than the width of .
