member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags
member.summary: This enum represents an annotation flags

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Default
member.summary: Not specified.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Invisible
member.summary: If set, do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the standard annotation types and no annotation handler is available. If clear, display such an unknown annotation using an appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any (see 12.5.5, â€œAppearance Streamsâ€).

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Hidden
member.summary: (PDF 1.2) If set, do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with the user, regardless of its annotation type or whether an annotation handler is available. In cases where screen space is limited, the ability to hide and show annotations selectively can be used in combination with appearance streams (see 12.5.5, â€œAppearance Streamsâ€) to display auxiliary pop-up information similar in function to online help systems.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Print
member.summary: (PDF 1.2) If set, print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen. This can be useful for annotations representing interactive pushbuttons, which would serve no meaningful purpose on the printed page.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoZoom
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not scale the annotationâ€™s appearance to match the magnification of the page. The location of the annotation on the page (defined by the upper-left corner of its annotation rectangle) shall remain fixed, regardless of the page magnification. See further discussion following this Table.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoRotate
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not rotate the annotationâ€™s appearance to match the rotation of the page. The upper-left corner of the annotation rectangle shall remain in a fixed location on the page, regardless of the page rotation. See further discussion following this Table.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoView
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the setting of the Print flag) but should be considered hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not allow the annotation to interact with the user. The annotation may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the NoView and Print flags) but should not respond to mouse clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag shall be ignored for widget annotations; its function is subsumed by the ReadOnly flag of the associated form field (see Table 221).

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Locked
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to the annotationâ€™s contents, such as the value of a form field.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.ToggleNoView
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) If set, invert the interpretation of the NoView flag for certain events. A typical use is to have an annotation that appears only when a mouse cursor is held over it.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.LockedContents
member.summary: (PDF 1.7) If set, do not allow the contents of the annotation to be modified by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties, such as position and size.

member.summary: Two short lines meeting in an acute angle as in the OpenArrow style and connected by a third line to form a triangular closed arrowhead filled with the annotationâ€™s interior color, if any.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationReplyType
member.summary: In PDF 1.6, a set of annotations may be grouped so that they function as a single unit when a user interacts with them. The group consists of a primary annotation, which shall not have an entry, and one or more subordinate annotations, which shall have an entry that refers to the primary annotation and an entry whose value is Group.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationReplyType.Single
member.summary: The annotation shall be considered a reply to the annotation specified by . Conforming readers shall not display replies to an annotation individually but together in the form of threaded comments.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationBorderStyle.#ctor(System.Double,Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationBorderType,Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.PageProperties.BoxStyleDashPattern)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The border width in points. If this value is 0, no border shall drawn. Default value: 1.

A dash array defining a pattern of dashes and gaps that shall beused in drawing a dashed border (border type is ). The dash array shall be specified in the same format as in the line dash pattern parameter of the graphics state. The dash phase is not specified and shall be assumed to be 0. EXAMPLE A dash entry of [3 2] specifies a border drawn with 3-point dashes alternating with 2-point gaps.

member.param: The border width in points. If this value is 0, no border shall drawn. Default value: 1.

A dash array defining a pattern of dashes and gaps that shall beused in drawing a dashed border (border type is ). The dash array shall be specified in the same format as in the line dash pattern parameter of the graphics state. The dash phase is not specified and shall be assumed to be 0. EXAMPLE A dash entry of [3 2] specifies a border drawn with 3-point dashes alternating with 2-point gaps.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.MarkupAnnotation.Intent
member.summary: Gets or sets the intent. A name describing the intent of the markup annotation. Intents allow conforming readers to distinguish between different uses and behaviors of a single markup annotation type. If this entry is not present or its value is the same as the annotation type, the annotation shall have no explicit intent and should behave in a generic manner in a conforming reader.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.FixedPrint.Matrix
member.summary: Gets or sets The matrix used to transform the annotationâ€™s rectangle before rendering. Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0]. When positioning content near the edge of a page, this entry should be used to provide a reasonable offset to allow for nonburnable margins.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.FixedPrint.HTranslate
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount to translate the associated content horizontally, as a percentage of the width of the target media (or if unknown, the width of the pageâ€™s MediaBox). 1.0 represents 100% and 0.0 represents 0%. Negative values should not be used, since they may cause content to be drawn off the page. Default value: 0.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.FixedPrint.VTranslate
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount to translate the associated content vertically, as a percentage of the height of the target media (or if unknown, the height of the pageâ€™s MediaBox). 1.0 represents 100% and 0.0 represents 0%. Negative values should not be used, since they may cause content to be drawn off the page. Default value: 0.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.FreeTextAnnotation
member.summary: This class represents a free text annotation. A free text annotation displays text directly on the page. Unlike an ordinary text annotation, a free text annotation has no open or closed state; instead of being displayed in a pop-up window, the text shall be always visible.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the text. The color is an array of numbers that shall be in the range 0.0 to 1.0 specifying the colour of the widget annotationâ€™s border. The number of array elements determines the colour space in which the colour shall bedefined: 0 No colour; transparent 1 DeviceGray 3 DeviceRGB 4 DeviceCMYK

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.FreeTextAnnotation.QuaddingJustification
member.summary: Gets or sets the code specifying the form of quadding (justification) that shall be used in displaying the annotationâ€™s text

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.FreeTextAnnotation.Callout
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of four or six numbers specifying a callout line attached to the free text annotation. Six numbers [ x1 y1 x2 y2 x3 y3 ] represent the starting, knee point, and ending coordinates of the line in default user space. Four numbers [ x1 y1 x2 y2 ] represent the starting and ending coordinates of the line.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.FreeTextAnnotation.LineEndingStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a that shall be used in drawing the callout line specified in . The value shall specify the line ending style for the endpoint defined by the pairs of coordinates (x1, y1). Default value: .

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconFitSettings
member.summary: This class represents a icon fit settings.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconFitSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconFitSettings.ScaleMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the circumstances under which the icon shall be scaled inside the annotation rectangle

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconFitSettings.ScaleType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of scaling that shall be used.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconFitSettings.FitBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to fit bounds. If true, indicates that the button appearance shall be scaled to fit fully within the bounds of the annotation without taking into consideration the line width of the border. Default value: false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconFitSettings.LeftoverSpaceFraction
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of two numbers that shall be between 0.0 and 1.0 indicating the fraction of leftover space to allocate at the left and bottom of the icon. A value of [0.0 0.0] shall position the icon at the bottom-left corner of the annotation rectangle. A value of [0.5 0.5] shall center it within the rectangle. This entry shall be used only if the icon is scaled proportionally. Default value: [0.5 0.5].

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconScaleMode
member.summary: This enum represents the list of icon scale modes.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconScaleMode.AlwaysScale
member.summary: Always scale.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconScaleMode.IconBigger
member.summary: Scale only when the icon is bigger than the annotation rectangle.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconScaleMode.IconSmaller
member.summary: Scale only when the icon is smaller than the annotation rectangle.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconScaleMode.NeverScale
member.summary: Never scale.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconScaleType
member.summary: This enum represents the allowed list of the icon scale types.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconScaleType.Anamorphic
member.summary: Scale the icon to fill the annotation rectangle exactly, without regard to its original aspect ratio (ratio of width to height).

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IconScaleType.Proportional
member.summary: Scale the icon to fit the width or height of the annotation rectangle while maintaining the iconâ€™s original aspect ratio. If the required horizontal and vertical scaling factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the icon within the annotation rectangle in the other dimension.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.IntentStyle.FreeText
member.summary: The annotation is intended to function as a plain free-text annotation. A plain free-text annotation is also known as a text box comment.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation
member.summary: This class represents a line annotation. The purpose of a line annotation is to display a single straight line on the page. When opened, it shall display a pop-up window containing the text of the associated note.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags,Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationBorderStyle)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.SetCaptionOffset(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the caption offset.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.SetCoordinates(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the coordinates.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.Coordinates
member.summary: Gets or sets the coordinates. An array of four numbers, [x1 y1 x2 y2], specifying the starting and ending coordinates of the line in default user space. If the entry is present, this value shall represent the endpoints of the leader lines rather than the endpoints of the line itself

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.LeaderLineLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the leader line. The length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular to the line itself. A positive value shall mean that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by ); a negative value shall indicate the opposite direction. Default value: 0 (no leader lines).
member.value: The length of the leader line.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.LeaderLineExtensions
member.summary: Gets or sets the leader line extensions. A non-negative number that shall represents the length of leader line extensions that extend from the line proper 180 degrees from the leader lines. Default value: 0 (no leader line extensions).

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.LeaderLineOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the leader line offset. A non-negative number that shall represent the length of the leader line offset, which is the amount of empty space between the endpoints of the annotation and the beginning of the leader lines.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.UseCaption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use or as caption in the appearance of the line. If true, the text specified by the or entries shall be replicated as a caption in the appearance of the line. The text shall be rendered in a manner appropriate to the content, taking into account factors such as writing direction. Default value: false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.StartLineEndingStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the start line ending style.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.EndLineEndingStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the end line ending style.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.CaptionPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the caption position. A name describing the annotationâ€™s caption positioning. Valid values are Inline, meaning the caption shall be centered inside the line, and Top, meaning the caption shall be on top of the line. Default value: Inline

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LineAnnotation.CaptionOffset
member.summary: Gets the caption offset. An array of two numbers that shall specify the offset of the caption text from its normal position. The first value shall be the horizontal offset along the annotation line from its midpoint, with a positive value indicating offset to the right and a negative value indicating offset to the left. The second value shall be the vertical offset perpendicular to the annotation line, with a positive value indicating a shift up and a negative value indicating a shift down. Default value: [0, 0] (no offset from normal positioning)

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LinkAnnotation
member.summary: This class represents a link annotation represents either a hypertext link to a destination elsewhere in the document or an action to be performed.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LinkAnnotation.#ctor(Apitron.PDF.Kit.FixedLayout.Boundary,Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationFlags,Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.AnnotationBorderStyle)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

example.code: LinkAnnotation link = new LinkAnnotation( new Boundary(10, 170, 100, 190), AnnotationFlags.Locked, new AnnotationBorderStyle(5, AnnotationBorderType.Underline));

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LinkAnnotation.Action
member.summary: Gets or sets an action that shall be performed when the link annotation is activated

example.code: LinkAnnotation link = new LinkAnnotation( new Boundary(10, 170, 100, 190), AnnotationFlags.Locked, new AnnotationBorderStyle(5, AnnotationBorderType.Beveled)); link.Action = new JavaScriptAction("app.alert('This is JS alert!');");

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LinkAnnotation.Destination
member.summary: Gets or sets a destination that shall be displayed when the annotation is activated.

example.code: LinkAnnotation link = new LinkAnnotation( new Boundary(10, 170, 100, 190), AnnotationFlags.Locked, new AnnotationBorderStyle(5, AnnotationBorderType.Beveled)); link.Destination = new Destination(3); // to the 3rd page

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.LinkAnnotation.HighlightingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotationâ€™s highlighting mode, the visual effect that shall be used when the mouse button is pressed or held down inside its active area

example.code: LinkAnnotation link = new LinkAnnotation( new Boundary(10, 170, 100, 190), AnnotationFlags.Locked, new AnnotationBorderStyle(5, AnnotationBorderType.Beveled)); link.HighlightingMode = AnnotationHighlightingMode.Invert;

member.summary: Gets or sets an array of 8 Ã— n numbers specifying the coordinates of n quadrilaterals in default user space that comprise the region in which the link should be activated.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.RedactionAnnotation.GetQuadPoints
member.summary: Gets an array of 8 Ã— n numbers specifying the coordinates of nquadrilaterals in default user space. Each quadrilateral shall encompasses a word or group of contiguous words in the text underlying the annotation. The coordinates for each quadrilateral shall be given in the order: x1 y1 x2 y2 x3 y3 x4 y4 specifying the quadrilateralâ€™s four vertices in counterclockwise order. The text shall be oriented with respect to the edge connecting points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2).
member.returns: The array of edges of connecting points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2).

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.RedactionAnnotation.Overlay
member.summary: Gets or sets a form XObject specifying the overlay appearance for this redaction annotation. After this redaction is applied and the affected content has been removed, the overlay appearance should be drawn such that its origin lines up with the lower-left corner of the annotation rectangle. This form XObject is not necessarily related to other annotation appearances, and may or may not be present in the APdictionary. This entry takes precedence over the IC, OverlayText, DA, and Q entries.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.RedactionAnnotation.OverlayText
member.summary: Gets or sets a text string specifying the overlay text that should be drawn over the redacted region after the affected content has been removed. This entry is ignored if the RO entry is present.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.RedactionAnnotation.Repeat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is repeat. If true, then the text specified by OverlayText should be repeated to fill the redacted region after the affected content has been removed. This entry is ignored if the entry is present. Default value: false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Annotations.RedactionAnnotation.QuaddingJustification
member.summary: Gets or sets a code specifying the form of quadding (justification) to be used in laying out the overlay text.

member.summary: Gets or sets the OC. An optional content group or optional content membership dictionary specifying the optional content properties for the annotation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the AFC.

member.summary: Gets or sets a JavaScript action that shall be performed to recalculate the value of this field when that of another field changes. member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.SignatureFlags
member.summary: This enum represents a allowed signature flags.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.SignatureFlags.Default
member.summary: No one flag is set.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.SignatureFlags.SignaturesExist
member.summary: If set, the document contains at least one signature field. This flag allows a conforming reader to enable user interface items (such as menu items or pushbuttons) related to signature processing without having to scan the entire document for the presence of signature fields.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.SignatureFlags.AppendOnly
member.summary: If set, the document contains signatures that may be invalidated if the file is saved (written) in a way that alters its previous contents, as opposed to an incremental update. Merely updating the file by appending new information to the end of the previous version is safe. Conforming readers may use this flag to inform a user requesting a full save that signatures will be invalidated and require explicit confirmation before continuing with the operation.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags
member.summary: This enum contains flags specifying various characteristics of the field.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.Default
member.summary: Not specified.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.ReadOnly
F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.Required
member.summary: If set, the field shall have a value at the time it is exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.NoExport
member.summary: If set, the field shall not be exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.NoToggleToOff
member.summary: (Radio buttons only) If set, exactly one radio button shall be selected at all times; selecting the currently selected button has no effect. If clear, clicking the selected button deselects it, leaving no button selected.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.Radio
member.summary: If set, the field is a set of radio buttons; if clear, the field is a check box. This flag may be set only if the PushButton flag is clear.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.Pushbutton
member.summary: If set, the field is a pushbutton that does not retain a permanent value.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.RadiosInUnison
member.summary: If set, a group of radio buttons within a radio button field that use the same value for the on state will turn on and off in unison; that is if one is checked, they are all checked. If clear, the buttons are mutually exclusive (the same behavior as HTML radio buttons).

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.Multiline
member.summary: If set, the field may contain multiple lines of text; if clear, the fieldâ€™s text shall be restricted to a single line.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.Password
member.summary: If set, the field is intended for entering a secure password that should not be echoed visibly to the screen. Characters typed from the keyboard shall instead be echoed in some unreadable form, such as asterisks or bullet characters. NOTE To protect password confidentiality, readers should never store the value of the text field in the PDF file if this flag is set.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.FileSelect
member.summary: If set, the text entered in the field represents the pathname of a file whose contents shall be submitted as the value of the field.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheck
member.summary: If set, text entered in the field shall not be spell-checked.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.DoNotScroll
F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.Comb
member.summary: May be set only if the MaxLen entry is present in the text field dictionary (see Table 229) and if the Multiline, Password, and FileSelect flags are clear. If set, the field shall be automatically divided into as many equally spaced positions, or combs, as the value of MaxLen, and the text is laid out into those combs.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.RichText
member.summary: If set, the value of this field shall be a rich text string (see 12.7.3.4, â€œRich Text Stringsâ€). If the field has a value, the RV entry of the field dictionary (Table 222) shall specify the rich text string.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.Combo
member.summary: If set, the field is a combo box; if clear, the field is a list box.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.Edit
member.summary: If set, the combo box shall include an editable text box as well as a drop-down list; if clear, it shall include only a drop-down list. This flag shall be used only if the Combo flag is set.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.Sort
member.summary: If set, the fieldâ€™s option items shall be sorted alphabetically. This flag is intended for use by writers, not by readers. Conforming readers shall display the options in the order in which they occur in the Opt array.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.MultiSelect
member.summary: If set, more than one of the fieldâ€™s option items may be selected simultaneously; if clear, at most one item shall be selected.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.FieldFlags.CommitOnSelChange
member.summary: If set, the new value shall be committed as soon as a selection is made (commonly with the pointing device). In this case, supplying a value for a field involves three actions: selecting the field for fill-in, selecting a choice for the fill-in value, and leaving that field, which finalizes or â€œcommitsâ€ the data choice and triggers any actions associated with the entry or changing of this data. If this flag is on, then processing does not wait for leaving the field action to occur, but immediately proceeds to the third step. This option enables applications to perform an action once a selection is made, without requiring the user to exit the field. If clear, the new value is not committed until the user exits the field.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.Signature.Pkcs1Signature
member.summary: The PKCS#1 standard supports several public-key cryptographic algorithms and digest methods, including RSA encryption, DSA signatures, and SHA-1 and MD5 digests (see the Bibliography in PDF spec for references). For signing PDF files using PKCS#1, it's only allowed to use RSA encryption algorithm and SHA-1 digest method.

member.summary: Create a new StandardSignatureHandler best suited for a signing certificate.
member.remarks:
This method creates a signature handler best suited for signing based on the signing certificate's properties.
Note that a complete chain of certificates up to the root CA certificate or a self signed certificate is required within the key store.
member.param: The key store containing the private key.
The name that is associated with the private key in the store.
member.returns: Signature based on PKCS#12 store.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.Signature.Pkcs7DetachedSignature
member.summary: Security handlers may use public-key encryption technology to encrypt a document (or strings and streams within a document). When doing so, specifying one or more lists of recipients, where each list has its own unique access permissions may be done. Only specified recipients shall open the encrypted document or content, unlike the standard security handler, where a password determines access. The permissions defined for public-key security handlers are shown in Table 24 in 7.6.4.2, "Public-Key Encryption Dictionary" (PDF spec.). Public-key security handlers use the industry standard Public Key Cryptographic Standard Number 7 (PKCS#7) binary encoding syntax to encode recipient list, decryption key, and access permission information. The PKCS#7 specification is in Internet RFC 2315, PKCS #7: Cryptographic Message Syntax, Version 1.5 (see the Bibliography in PDF spec.). When encrypting the data, each recipientâ€™s X.509 public key certificate (as described in ITU-T Recommendation X.509; see the Bibliography in PDF spec.) shall be available. When decrypting the data, the conforming reader shall scan the recipient list for which the content is encrypted and shall attempt to find a match with a certificate that belongs to the user. If a match is found, the user requires access to the corresponding private key, which may require authentication, possibly using a password. Once access is obtained, the private key shall be used to decrypt the encrypted data.
member.remarks: The original signed message digest over the documentâ€™s byte range shall be incorporated as the normal PKCS#7 SignedData field. No data shall be encapsulated in the PKCS#7 SignedData field.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.Signature.Pkcs7Sha1Signature
member.summary: Security handlers may use public-key encryption technology to encrypt a document (or strings and streams within a document). When doing so, specifying one or more lists of recipients, where each list has its own unique access permissions may be done. Only specified recipients shall open the encrypted document or content, unlike the standard security handler, where a password determines access. The permissions defined for public-key security handlers are shown in Table 24 in 7.6.4.2, "Public-Key Encryption Dictionary" (PDF spec.). Public-key security handlers use the industry standard Public Key Cryptographic Standard Number 7 (PKCS#7) binary encoding syntax to encode recipient list, decryption key, and access permission information. The PKCS#7 specification is in Internet RFC 2315, PKCS #7: Cryptographic Message Syntax, Version 1.5 (see the Bibliography in PDF spec.). When encrypting the data, each recipientâ€™s X.509 public key certificate (as described in ITU-T Recommendation X.509; see the Bibliography in PDF spec.) shall be available. When decrypting the data, the conforming reader shall scan the recipient list for which the content is encrypted and shall attempt to find a match with a certificate that belongs to the user. If a match is found, the user requires access to the corresponding private key, which may require authentication, possibly using a password. Once access is obtained, the private key shall be used to decrypt the encrypted data.
member.remarks: The SHA1 digest of the documentâ€™s byte range shall be encapsulated in the PKCS#7 SignedData field with ContentInfo of type Data. The digest of that SignedData shall be incorporated as the normal PKCS#7 digest.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField
member.summary: This class represents a text field.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField.IsMultiline
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is multiline. If set, the field may contain multiple lines of text; if clear, the fieldâ€™s text shall be restricted to a single line.
member.value: true if this instance is multiline; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField.IsPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is password. If set, the field is intended for entering a secure password that should not be echoed visibly to the screen. Characters typed from the keyboard shall instead be echoed in some unreadable form, such as asterisks or bullet characters.
member.value: true if this instance is password; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField.IsFileSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is file select. If set, the text entered in the field represents the pathname of a file whose contents shall be submitted as the value of the field.
member.value: true if this instance is file select; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField.DoNotSpellCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether do not spell check. If set, text entered in the field shall not be spell-checked.
member.value: true if do not spell check; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField.DoNotScroll
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [do not scroll]. If set, the field shall not scroll (horizontally for single-line fields, vertically for multiple-line fields) to accommodate more text than fits within its annotation rectangle. Once the field is full, no further text shall be accepted for interactive form filling; for non-interactive form filling, the filler should take care not to add more character than will visibly fit in the defined area.
member.value: true if [do not scroll]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField.IsComb
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is comb. May be set only if the MaxLen entry is present in the text field and if the Multiline, Password, and FileSelect flags are clear. If set, the field shall be automatically divided into as many equally spaced positions, or combs, as the value of MaxLen, and the text is laid out into those combs.
member.value: true if this instance is comb; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField.MaxLen
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length of the fieldâ€™s text, in characters.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the field.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Forms.TextField.DefaultValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the default text.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Navigation.DisplayType
member.summary: This enum represents a page's dispaly options.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Navigation.DisplayType.Unknown
member.summary: Loacation is not specified.

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Navigation.DisplayType.XYZ
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter shall be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value. Used params: Left, Top, Zoom

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Navigation.DisplayType.Fit
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension. Used params: none

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Navigation.DisplayType.FitH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate toppositioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter shall be retained unchanged. Used params: Top

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Navigation.DisplayType.FitV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter shall be retained unchanged. Used params: Left

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Navigation.DisplayType.FitR
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and top entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the rectangle within the window in the other dimension. Used params: Left, Bottom, Right, Top,

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Navigation.DisplayType.FitB
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the bounding box within the window in the other dimension. Used params: none

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Navigation.DisplayType.FitBH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter shall be retained unchanged. Used params: Top

member.name: F:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Interactive.Navigation.DisplayType.FitBV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter shall be retained unchanged. Used params: Left

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.Appearance.ListCounter.ZeroBased
member.summary: Gets the zero based counter, items will be numbered starting from zero. This counter is used as default setting for latin markers.
member.remarks:
Zero, and .
"The number zero does not have its own Roman numeral, but the word nulla (the Latin word meaning "none") was used by medieval computists in lieu of 0. Dionysius Exiguus was known to use nulla alongside Roman numerals in 525. About 725, Bede or one of his colleagues used the letter N, the initial of nulla, in a table of epacts, all written in Roman numerals."[wikipedia]
So we use "N" to indicate zero in case of and "nulla" in case of .

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.Appearance.ListCounter.Standard

The block element creates new line before/after itself and can be explicitly sized using and properties.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.SelectorParseException
member.summary: Represents parsing exception, it's being thrown by when invalid input for the style selector is being given during style registration.

summary.para: Represents style information container, if one of the style properties is not set then it doesn't affect the element matched. The value for the setting will be inferred from other matching style or from directly set value (can be set via the element's property).
If there are no matching values for the setting and it's not set directly on the element instance then it will have the default value that depends on the element type.
Some of the style properties can be inherited while others affect only the directly matched element, each property has the description of this behavior.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.Style.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Style - is a set of properties that define ContentElementâ€™s appearance, very similar to CSS they help to tune the look of the element by employing internal styling system based on selectors.
Selector â€“ is a rule that defines which elements should be styled with the given set of properties, it consists of a rule itself that looks very similar to CSS notation and a property set. See help for more information on supported selectors.
All content elements have the same set of properties forming style, that can be set either directly or by using style selectors. A direct setting affects implicit style for the element and while selectors can affect multiple elements at once making it feasible to lessen the work needed to design a document.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.Style.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the background image for the element. The background of an element is the total size of the element, including padding (but not the margin and border). By default, a background-image is placed at the top-left corner of an element, and repeated both vertically and horizontally. Not inheritable.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.Style.BackgroundRepeat

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.Style.ScriptLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the value used to create subscripting or superscripting effect. It defines the level of effect, zero can be used for normal scripting, positive values are for superscripting, negative for subscripting. Affects textual elements. Not inheritable.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.Style.LineHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the line. On a block container element whose content is composed of inline-level elements, 'line-height' specifies the minimal height of line boxes within the element. On a non-inline element, 'line-height' specifies the height that is used in the calculation of the line box height. Inheritable.

member.name: P:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.Style.Align
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the elementâ€™s content, it can be Left, Right, Center aligned or Justified. Only acceptable for block elements, this property will be ignored if the element used is not a block. Left, Right, Center values are supported by all elements. In case of Justify is used â€“ only text elements will be affected. All elements inherit value from their block containers, only block elements can override parentâ€™s Align setting.

member.name: T:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.StyleManager
member.summary: Style manager, it's responsible for styles processing and resolving.

member.name: M:Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.StyleManager.RegisterStyle(System.String,Apitron.PDF.Kit.Styles.Style)
member.summary:
Registers style and provides access to it using its selector. Selector â€“ is a rule that defines which elements should be styled with the given set of properties, it consists of a rule itself that looks very similar to CSS notation and a property set.
Supported selectors:
Universal selector (â€œ*â€), selects all elements in document, represented as *.
Type selector (â€œ_typename_â€), selects all elements of the given type. E.g. â€œtextboxâ€. It's possible to list several types using comma, e.g. "textbox, section, image".
Class selector (â€œ.classnameâ€), selects all elements that belong to specific class. E.g. â€œ*.myclassâ€ selects all elements with class â€œmyclassâ€. Because element can have multiple classes set, it is possible to specify several classes in selector, for example â€œ*.myclass1.myclass2â€.
Id selector(â€œ#elementIDâ€). An element can have an id set, and this selector matches the element with specific id. Sample: â€œtexbox#helpâ€, selects the textbox element with ID â€œhelpâ€
Child selector (â€œ[ancestor]>childâ€), selects all elements that are immediate children of ancestor element, square brackets indicate optionality of the ancestor, in case of absence it will behave like as â€œ*â€ would be set.
Samples:
â€œ> textboxâ€ â€“ same as â€œtextboxâ€, selects all textboxes that are children of any element.
â€œsection > textbox â€ â€“ select all textboxes which are placed in sections
â€œflowdocument > section> textbox.subheaderâ€ â€“ selects all textboxes with class â€subheaderâ€ set, nested under any section that is a child of root element.
Descendant selector(â€œelement_1 element_2â€), selects all elements which are descendants of the given element.
Sample:
â€œsection#header imageâ€ â€“ selects all images in section with ID=â€headerâ€ regardless of the nesting.
Adjacent element selector (â€œpredessor + elementâ€), selects the element that precedes some element.
Sample:
â€œimage + textboxâ€ â€“ selects all images that precede a textbox.
How the styles are being resolved:
Directly assigned value is requested first. It's the value you set using arbitraty property of the content element.
If no value is set using p.1, we are trying to find its value using selectors and styles registered. a) look for all selectors that match given element b) select value according to matching rules (these rules are: specificity of the selector and order of addition, if specificity is the same, we use order)
Request parent's value if property is inheritable and use the same scheme In general this styling system is close to CSS used with HTML, so one familiar with the latter can easily find similarities.
member.exception: if one of the arguments is null.
